title: Supreme Court Gives Government New Tool to Fight Surveillance Lawsuit
sub_head: Case stems from an FBI plan that sent a bodybuilder to infiltrate an Irvine, Calif., mosque on a hunt for terrorists
body:
WASHINGTON—The Supreme Court Friday cleared the way for the government to argue that national security could be endangered if lower courts allowed a group of American Muslims to proceed with a lawsuit alleging the FBI targeted them for surveillance because of their religion.
The unanimous opinion left it to lower courts to decide if the government’s “state secrets” claim was enough to quash the case, which stems from a 2006 undercover operation that sent a bodybuilder to infiltrate an Irvine, Calif., mosque in a futile effort to find terrorists.
